text: Even if I`m not a microscopes builder.., I agree; I can see the niche that many L-sheets are filling; a bit like the world of Clearing Methods, they are probably application/sample specific. And I still defend the idea of multi-view: I`m impressed how the opposite double detection system (Luxendo MuVi, e.g.) is usfeul to scientists who (just on fixed samples - not caring about photo-toxicity) want to have quick full overview (even if just on the outer layer) of globuar, not transparent (!!), samples (organoids, gastruloids,..).  However, the OPM branch is exciting.
